questions.question: How did the colonists react to British laws leading up to the American Revolution?

choices.answer: Moved to New France
Moved to the Spanish colonies
Organized protests and boycotts
Sold goods to British troops
Colonists who believed the colonies should be free to from British rule
Colonists who believed the colonies should remain loyal to Britain
Colonists who wanted to go to war with Spain in the west
ï»¿Colonists who were unsure about being free of or remaining loyal to Britain

questions.question: Where did the minutemen get their name?

choices.answer: Could include small details in their map drawings
Could prepare an egg in a minute
Limited their speeches to one minute
Were ready to fight at a minute's notice

questions.question: Which of these was a belief of the Loyalists?

choices.answer: Young colonists should move to Britain.
Being part of a strong empire was best for the colonies.
Farmers should pay higher taxes.
Colonists need protection from each other and the Spanish.

questions.question: Which was the largest group in the colonies in the years leading up to the American Revolution?

choices.answer: Allies
Loyalists
Undecideds
Patriots

questions.question: Which of these was a belief of the Patriots?

choices.answer: The colonies should be free to run their own affairs.
All colonists should pay taxes to Britain.
All colonists should buy British tea.
The colonies should remain with Britain forever.

questions.question: Roughly, about _________ of the colonist were Loyalist.
The Loyalist were treated respectfully by the Patriots.

choices.answer: True
False
